Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: IslandTravelerHvl
Reviews.Content: We stay for 5 nights in this B&B, the room was renovated en clean. A little bit to small,but you can ask for a bigger room for the same price.The breakfast has a wide selection and very varied.The service on the frontdesk was good.Verry kindly people.Recommendable.We have made our reservation with booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Great value, beautiful area”
Reviews.Author: yvonne9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March, It was our first time to Berlin and we got a great deal B&B from booking.com We got train from airport and bought a weekly ticket which cost just under 20 euro at the time[would recommended getting weekly ticket,great value and hassle free travel]. we got out at Uhlandstraße and its a five minute walk on the same side as you get off. Hotel is located on Bleibtreustrasse; so take the left turn and its down on the right hand side, keep eye out, it is a very small sign. When we got inside ,staff were very friendly, room was very clean, small bathroom but vlean and rooms had very high ceilings[old victorian/georgian building]. Breakfast was brilliant a great variety and always full. Hotel has a lift and stairs. If staying at this hotel you have to try the italian restaurant and the other side of Bleibtreustrasse. Its called ali baba, food was gorgeous and very reasonable, ate in here a few times. www.alibaba-berlin.de great hotel if you get a deal

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Rutger13
Reviews.Content: The old and dated room was very dirty, stained carpeting, an incredible amount of dust in the air, mold in the bathroom, the bed was VERY uncomfortable, furniture was shabby and broken, etc. Breakfast was ok, but really nothing special, basically just some fruit, bread, cheese and coldcuts. Berlin is full of reasonably priced good quality hotels, but this is not one of them. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great locarion, clean and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: sino73
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband a week ago. Location is really good. Very easy access to/from the airport. Clean and comfortable room.Good breakfast. A good surprise for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Sort of a strange hotel, but in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: DublinFlyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a historical building, and currently they seem to be renovating it. It has somewhat of a makeshift feel about it. My room was long and narrow with furniture awkwardly placed at one end and the beds at the other end. It was a bit dreary but provided a comfortable enough nights sleep and had all the requisite facilities. Impossible for wheelchair users because of short stairs in hallway up to reception and lift area. The breakfast room is very beautiful and magically decorated for winter/Christmas. There is a long centre table that looks set for an epic feast, and plenty of side tables. The location is salubrious, with nice restauarnts and shops close by, and it is within walking distance of the Zoologischer Garten railway station, which is served by Schonefeld Airport rail express and only costs €2.80!! I went to see the Christmas markets and there is one near to the hotel, and several others can be accessed via the hop-on, hop-off tourist buses which start off nearby on the Ku'damm. A taxi from airport costs about €36. On balance this hotel is perfectly satisfactory, but it might not be the place to stay on a special holiday.

Reviews.Title: “worst reception staff ever”
Reviews.Author: goodolmum
Reviews.Content: Clean basic room but nothing like pictures suggested. ?? Broken shower screen and mouldy bathroom shower. Soap dispenser in shower was empty upon arrival and remained so. Good breakfast, typical german, nothing extraordinary. When I asked for more coffee, was given the coffee can from the next table, who had left. !! Bed was comfortable and I slept well though, old building does have charm. Reception staff (Russian) spoke very little german, virtually no english either. Very unfriendly, super slow and demanded copy of passport for records. I was very uncomfortable with this. No friendly greeting, only shoulder shrugs and eye rolling. Definitely worst reception staff I have ever come across. Very heavy doors which made entry with luggage very unpleasant and difficult. One flight of steps (no lift) to reception also made things very difficult with luggage. Tiny old one person lift made me choose the steps to second story as well.. with very heavy luggage almost impossible as steps are spiralling. Can't possibly recommend this hotel after my experience.

Reviews.Title: “For the no frills traveler”
Reviews.Author: Moose527
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the beds were comfortable, but the staff is extremely helpful in their ability to provide tourist information since most of the staff is from Russia. The front desk is closed overnigt and there is no assistance available. A great location and a good hotel if you don't need suggestions or support..

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed at this old-fashioned hotel several times because of its convenient location and fair price.”
Reviews.Author: globalNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptionally well located just one-half block from the fashionable Ku-damm shopping street and close to public transportation. It is an old building and the elevator is quite dated, but the rooms are remodeled (at least those on the third floor) and the bathrooms are very modern. The breakfast room is large and welcoming and the buffet meal offers plenty of variety and good quality breads and cold cuts and fruit. Rates are quite reasonable. globalNewYorkCity

Reviews.Title: “probably the worst staff in the world”
Reviews.Author: elguido
Reviews.Content: Berlin is a nice city, strange but nice... This hotel was a disaster though. It is very hard to say what was worst. The entrance is horrible (not that that is important), it's an old apartment building and on arrival you already become sad that you didn't make a reservation next door. On entering the hotel you are "impressed" by the dirty, uninviting feeling. The rooms are not at all like they are shown on the internet, they are wornout, small, oldfashioned and dirty. Your back will kill you every morning again on your crawl to the bathroom. if you finally reach it (not because of the size of the room, but because of the back injury!) you once again will be disappointed for spending your money for a louzy stay. Please avoid the staff, they will try to ruin your day with their "friendly" faces and their lack of service. If you have the nerve to go and ask for the Wifi password you will be surprised to receive it with a smile (....NOT!!!) after 20 minutes. The breakfast is ok, but nothing special (you know, old croissants and so on...) One things is possitive about the hotel: the old lady who serves you at breakfast. To cut a long story short: oh no, I won't go there again!

Reviews.Title: “you win some, you lose some: in this case it was the last”
Reviews.Author: Viky1983
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the things about this place. The elder breakfast lady is a very sweet and kind woman. The breakfast itself and the coffee were good. One gets bored with it after the 4th night but that's normal, that happens everywhere. It's location was very good too, right at the Ku'Damm and not too far from for example the Gedächtniskirche. Berlin is huge so of course it was quite far from other 'to do's', which is normal for it's size. It was anyway a good idea to have the hotel near this very long shopping street, because the bags were getting heavy after a while. Now the bad list. The hotel is aged and I still wonder where they got the pictures they placed online. We got room 27 and we stayed there for 4 nights. It was a really small and unpleasant room that didn't have a relaxing atmosphere at all and that you wanted to escape from as soon as you stepped in. The bathroom was very small as well and the shower was very annoying to get out of and even a bit dangerous for slipping out because there is a very large step down. Between the end of the bed and the wall was 40 cm in space and the TV was hanging at the left of the bed in the corner where the bed was placed against. So your neck started hurting very much while looking at the tv and the person on the right wasn't able to see the tv at all. The 'twin' bed was a box with 2 matrasses in and the bed couldn't be put pulled into 2 pieces a twin should normally be able to. The matrasses were of no quality at all, not of age, just no support whilst sleeping so that; combined with the room getting really hot at night, resulted in 4 nights of hardly sleep and a very sour back. About the staff, I do not expect much, I don't even want those fake smiles at reception that so often hotelguest demand, I just want to be treated the same way as I treat people. What I do not like is being treated rudely. I went to reception 5 times in 4 days, the morning after the Sunday evening we checked in (that was 8.10 pm and we had to pick up the key in the other hotel). I stood there like an idiot, not like a paying guest, waiting for at least 10 minutes until the woman behind reception decided to put her personal call on hold (yes I do understand a bit of Russian) to see what I wanted. I just wanted to check in officially. Another time was for the code of the wireless. With dread I was given it. The 3rd time was on the last complete day that we were spending another night. I wanted to get a second key of the room because we were going our seperate ways (you even need the key during the day to get into the building). Instead of just getting the key we were told that we still had to pay for the first night (we made a prepaid for 3 nights then decided to add another night). I must admit I found this quite offensive as if I was a fraud because there was still a bill to be paid. We were checking out the next day and normally guest pay at check out, so this comment wasn't necessary for anything. The 4th time was the next day to check out and the last time was to pick up our luggage and ask for a taxi. In the hallway on the 2nd floor there was a foul smell throughout our stay, maybe airing the wallways wouldn't be a bad idea. To conclude, I really didn't like the place and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I think this place should be called a hotel at all. In my opinion this place is a total rip off. However I didn't let all this spoil my holiday and I must say I am impressed with Berlin and I very much enjoyed being a Berliner for 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Nataleigh
Reviews.Content: Wow - we couldn't have imagined for anything better. I was a little unsure given it was soooooo cheap, but when we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. We didn't arrive until 11pm, and because their reception closes at 9pm, they had left our key with the hotel next door. Our room was so large and had absolutely everything you needed. A beautiful balcony from our window overlooking the main street, and the bathroom was just immaculate! Probably the cleanest bathroom I had ever seen in my life. The one down side would be the beds... it was two singles pushed together and normally you can live with this, there was a big piece of wood in the middle so there was no chance of a cuddle in the night. The location was just great also! A two minute walk from the station, and lots of great restaurants and bars close by. Would definitely recommend this hotel and this area to any others going to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect xmas!”
Reviews.Author: vixnz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for me and my boyfriend at the last minute and was just crossing my fingers that the place was decent because i got three nights incl brekkie for 117Euro. The place was so much more than i hoped for! The first person we spoke to at reception was lovely and let us have our room at 8am, the place was imaculate but wasn't very big so retained a lot of character. The room was also immaculate and huge! (although other rooms we saw were smaller) Really high ceilings, radiator that kept us warm through xmas, T.V and ensuite. The only hitch was the shower, it was barely a trickle- but hot none the less! Savignyplatz railway station was just down the road and Zoologischer Garten was just a bit further. Breakfast was a full on buffet with a lovely lady who brought us coffee every morning. We were delighted with the place! A big thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have've been in this hotel for 5 days during a holiday in Berlin. We liked the hotel very much: very centrally located (near Ku'damm, not far from the Zoologisher Garten), near to the bus and to the S-Bahn (2 minutes walk from the bus, about 10 minutes from the S-Bahn). The rooms are clean and quite large, and the breakfast is continental with a good choice. If I go again in Berlin, I'll stay at this hotel for sure!

HotelInfo.Name: Elba am Kurfurstendamm
HotelInfo.Address: Bleibtreustrasse 26, 10707 Berlin, Germany
